comment: I did get an A in this class. HOWEVER, IF YOU DO NOT READ THE BOOK YOU WILL FAIL. I believe she is a good professor but she does not spoon feed you. You must read and study to make an A. Take her ONLY IF you can be dedicated to the course.

DO NOT TAKE HER!treats students like high school kids (calling on students randomly to answer questions). Voice is horrible! rambles about material unrelated to class. Makes material seem harder than actually is. Study hours in order to get at least a B. Serious GPA killer!!!!
I love this teacher, she makes every thing so clear. She gives out lots of extra credit. Easy A.

She is not into power points so if you learn that way like I do you might want to set in another class as well. She is very easy going and laid back but really doesn't explain things in great detail so you might be confused at first. If you don't read the book you might have a hard time. Overall she is a good professor and I would recommend her but you MUST do your work and stint hard

Her clas is soooooo easy and she gives you extra credit for everything. Just show up to class. She works all the homework problems in class before it's due.  Doesn't read from a powewrpoint, works lots of problems, so you grasp the subject matter much better! There is NO reason to get anything less than a B in this class. I would take her again
OMG, I love her. She gives out a lot of extra credit. all the graded homework, she does it in class. you get two attempt on the quizzes. She is awesome. Take her class.

I did not like this class. DO all the work, following the syllabus WORD FOR WORD, or you will get 10 points off for having your name in the wrong spot. Her tests are hard, she cant even get a 100% on them. There are alot of assignments which help your grade. Her powerpoints are POINTLESS. Read EVERY chapter.

Great professor.  I got so much extra credit I got to exempt the final and get an A in the class.  She incorporates extra points into every assignment to the point that the students get addicted to it.  She's clear about the material but I'd say a bit old fashioned.  Pencil and paper on a projector for the class notes.
Mandatory attendance. Assigned seating. I feel like she treats us ALL like freshmen.

I studied harder for this class than I did any class taken.  I was just totally frustrated at the level of teaching but moreso my level of comprehension.  No disrespect to the professor but her teaching style just didn mesh with my learning style.

This class is by no means easy but she gives you ALOT of grades. If your willing to put the hours into it then I would chose this teacher. Although she has absolutely no clue how to teach. As far as attendance it isn't required, but she takes it into consideration. I did not find her welcoming or knowledgable & was frusterated when asked a question

I loved her! I'd taker her again. She does give a lot of assignments, but if you tend to not do as well on tests, it's really great because of all those free points you get to make up for it. She lets you have a cheat sheet on the final, and attendance is not mandatory, but encouraged. Gives weekly bonus points! SO easy!
Very knowledgable but has no clue how to teach that knowledge. Also overloads you with assignments.

This teacher is horrible. Way too hard and teaches material in a way that doesn't help you at all on the tests. The budget project takes over 5 hours to do. She is overall very stubborn and doesn't work with the students. A super nerd who doesn't have any people skills. Class is boring and hard. Her aura exemplifies negativity. So glad i'm out.

This class is difficult if you make it that way. There are multiple attempts for all hw and quizzes. Keep up with the work and study for the tests and its easy. Ignore the comment about tests not being like the classes. She works hard to go over as many problems as possible. If people get a bad grade here its because they are lazy

im not very good at accounting, but this class is not so bad. attendance isnt mandatory (but you should go), quiz and homework assignment with every chapter(on homework manager), and she lets you have a couple of attempts so you can get a better grade. Lots of extra credit, very organized and the classes are very strucutred. i would recommend!

Stay away!  Her class is extremely hard, 3 tests and a comprehensive final.  There is an opportunity for extra credit but not that much and it takes ALOT of work.  There is also a Budget project at the end of the semester that takes at least 4 hours to complete.  The material she teaches in class and whats on the test are completely different.

I am taking her Friday class. She goes over tons of examples and asks the class questions to make sure they understand. Attendance is mandatory since each week will cover a chapter or two. There is a quiz and homework due per chapter. These help out alot for the test. Overall I would say this is a pretty easy class. I actually enjoy it.
Run for dear life.  Homework and quizzes due every week, plus three tests and a comprehensive final. Besides being boring she will make it harder than it has to be, just to prove her point!

Lectures are not organized & very, very boring. Many assignments = many chances to boost your grade. You get 3 trys at each homework & it will give you feedback on how to solve it correctly - 2 trys for each quiz. Overall, easy class, but it's definitly a snoozer.

you will have to deal with stuff like this on a daily basis.....Many of you are not putting this assignment on 8 1/2 x 11 paper. Some notebook paper is smaller than 8 1/2 x 11, this is NOT acceptable. The corect size is that of standard paper I marked 1 point off... I have also requested that you not have rough edges on your submission. One point

Pretty good teacher, the material is very hard so she does the best she can. Willing to help you with absolutely anything. Have lots of homework and quizzes online to boost your grade. Tests are o.k., lots of formulas to memorize and study. All around a pretty good teacher. A little boring because she lectures practically every day.
